headline: Stocks, Dollar Sink on Threats to Fed Independence: Markets Wrap

headline: World Economic Forum Chair Klaus Schwab Resigns After 55 Years, Interim Successor Takes Over
summary: Klaus Schwab, Founder and Chairman of the World Economic Forum’s (WEF) Board of Trustees, has officially resigned after 55 years of service in the Geneva-based institution. Schwab, who is entering his 88th year, informed the Board of Trustees of his decision, effective immediately. “Following my recent announcement, and as I enter my 88th year, I have decided to step down from the position of Chair and as a member of the Board of Trustees, with immediate effect,” Schwab stated in an official rel

headline: World Economic Forum founder Klaus Schwab retires as chairman
summary: Klaus Schwab, the founder of the World Economic Forum, best known for hosting an annual meeting of political, business and other elites in the Swiss Alpine town of Davos, is retiring as chairman more than a half-century after creating the Geneva-based think tank, the forum said Monday.  The forum quoted Schwab, 87, in a statement as saying he was stepping down “with immediate effect."  A search committee has been set up to choose a permanent successor.

headline: Investment Bank Downgrades AMZN on Earnings Pressures
summary: Investment bank Raymond James downgraded its rating on Amazon (AMZN) to Outperform from Strong Buy, Schwab Network reported today. According to the investment bank, Wall Street is “underestimating Amazon’s earnings pressures in 2025 and 2026.” Raymond James slashed its price target on AMZN to $195 from $275. headline: Charles Schwab Extends Partnership With National Youth Development Organization 4-H
summary: WESTLAKE, Texas, April 21, 2025--Schwab extends its long-standing partnership with National 4-H Council (4-H), which reaches nearly 6 million young people each year.

headline: Davos gathering founder Klaus Schwab quits as World Economic Forum chair
summary: ZURICH (Reuters) -Klaus Schwab, founder of the World Economic Forum, whose annual gathering of business and political leaders in the Swiss mountain resort of Davos became a symbol of globalisation, has resigned as chair of its trustees.  The Geneva-based WEF made the announcement on Monday after revealing earlier this month that the 87-year-old Schwab, who for decades has been the face of the Davos get-together, would be stepping down, without giving a firm timeline.  "Following my recent announcement, and as I enter my 88th year, I have decided to step down from the position of Chair and as a member of the Board of Trustees, with immediate effect," Schwab said in a statement released by the WEF.
